Articles.Content:
The Infini-Glider Challenge

The space plane must be able to fly, When it is out of fuel it must be capable of gliding. [scott Manley's demo video easter egg you'll hear an infini glider] All the way down and still be able to land a safe landing. (If the craft needs a few parachutes to help it land, Those *MAY* have an exception, Depends how much work the user's doing and how much the parachute's doing)

*DEADLINE EXTENDED* = IN TWO DAYS THIS CHALLENGE WILL BE ENDED SO SEND IN YOUR ENTRIES.

It doesn't have to be capable of gliding forever

Rules

No ALT-F12 Menu

Modded Entries *MAY* Have an exception, So go ahead an ask me!

Picture proof *REQUIRED*

Judging

Winner's will be chosen by number of minutes or how long the craft glided without Fuel.

Edited January 7, 2014 by ThatKerbal

Winner=number of minutes? Infini-Glider...is infinite...remember?

Download here.

Flight Profile:-

Press Q or R to 'roll' craft to altitude about 100meter.

Then turn to any direction 90 degree, after a few second, turn back to 0 degree, and you got yourself a floating object.

If tap rapidly on left and right, it can go supersonic. Like...LLLLRRRRRLLLLRRRRRLLLLRRR

Edited January 6, 2014 by Sirine
I guess we have a winner if noone else posts a entry by... 8:00 PM Then Sirine is the winner!
extend that deadline and I could have an entry by at least 10, perhaps earlier.
I have a thread for this, one of mine reached 6162 m/s atmospheric.
I'm sure that i posted mine first And deadline extended For 2 More Days.
I posted mine a long time ago. Don't worry, it is fine.
Do infigliders still work in 0.23? I though that control surfaces moved a lot slower now.
Also, I suggest increasing the time until the challenge expires. 4 days is far too short as some people have real-world schedules that prevent extensive use of KSP during those days.

I have no evidence of ever doing it, but at one point, I left an infiniglider with SAS on moving supersonic at 23 km unattended for 15 hours, by which time, it had circumnavigated over 4 times and was near the north pole.

Here's mi submission: Ze glider! Completely stock BTW.

Takes off with those two sepratrons, and can fly eternally. Now, both Sirine's and mine can fly forever, so we both win. Guess you should have written different rules.
Yeah, the OP thought it would be a good idea to make a challenge: "how long are you willing to leave your PC running"
I purposed this same challenge but under the name eternal flyer
